intro: Callista haemoglossa, commonly known as the red-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking red stems and bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
